cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles south of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW across Cuba, then turning northwest over the east-central Gulf of Mexico with a projected approach toward the Texas–Louisiana coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border (south-central Louisiana coastline)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Texas through western Louisiana likely to experience the core impacts
weather_observation.wind: Up to tropical-storm-force winds possible; 54 % chance of ≥34 kt and 27 % chance of ≥50 kt within the next five days at Galveston.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for storm surge exceeding 3 ft along the Upper Texas coast if the center tracks near the TX-LA border.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands associated with Laura could drop 4–6 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood risk around Galveston.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas and dangerous surf will hamper vessel movements and may necessitate port closure or restrictions 24–36 h before closest approach.
